experience: For years, I helped craft the product roadmap at Lucidchart. Eventually, I made the hard decision to give this role away due to a significant mistake.

When we were small - 10 people - we held our first quarterly planning and brainstormed how to improve the product. We voted to prioritize the ideas on the whiteboard and formalized the plan. Together.
As we grew - 25 people - we still brainstormed together but group prioritization no longer seemed efficient. I opted to prioritize with the executive team and report back.

As we scaled - 50 people - I began to question the value of the meetings altogether. Some team members lacked context; many ideas seemed too incremental. So, I no longer scheduled the brainstorms. I decided to develop the plan myself.
Soon a growing chorus emerged of those who felt they had lost their influence on product strategy. One remarked it had become "the Dave show."

Painful to hear. Even more painful to realize they were right. I had disregarded one of our core principles - Teamwork over Ego. To help rectify it quickly, I handed the product reins to a fantastic colleague and focused on Lucid’s growing needs elsewhere.
Consensus decision-making is not scalable. But - regardless of size - always make time and effort to ensure everyone has a voice.

[We are hiring] Lucid Software is a leading provider of cloud-based visual productivity applications. Lucidchart, a diagramming application, and Lucidpress, a design solution, are used in over 175 countries by more than 9 million users, including Comcast, NASA, Netflix, Target and Uber. Since the Utah-based company’s founding in 2010, Lucid Software has grown in revenue by nearly 100 percent each year and has received numerous awards for its business and workplace culture. Currently oversee all of our ABM, events, webinars, social media, and social selling marketing efforts.
Published courses: Social Selling with Twitter, Social Selling with LinkedIn. Ping me for more details if you'd like to watch them free for 30 days.

The traditional sales email is about to get disrupted...With Nova, you can create individualized, 1:1 personalized sales emails in seconds. Sales reps from all over the world use Nova’s account intelligence technologies to drive 4x more sales qualified leads and close more deals. Check it out. You'll thank me later.

xvoyant is a SaaS sales coaching platform that helps sales leaders remove the guesswork and create predictable, sustainable revenue through coaching execution. Built natively right inside of Salesforce. The future of sales coaching is here.

Trained and coached 66 sales reps (inside sales and field reps) on B2B social selling strategies, tools, and best practices focusing specifically on LinkedIn Sales Navigator and Twitter. Served in the California, Anaheim LDS mission speaking Spanish and English. About The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints: Members of the church, often called "Mormons", believe first and foremost that Jesus Christ is our Savior and Redeemer. Learn more at https://www.mormon.org/ or https://www.lds.org/.We also believe that through Jesus Christ all humankind may enjoy eternal life with their families in God’s kingdom (see John 3:16). We also believe that we lived with God as spirits before we were born (see Romans 8:16) and that according to His plan of happiness we came to earth to receive physical bodies in order to learn and grow. Mormons also believe that, through the work done in temples of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, family relationships can last forever. In order to receive these blessings, we must seek to know and follow God’s will, as revealed by holy scriptures and living prophets, and live righteously. And we must repent when we make mistakes.

Everybody smiles when they see Gabe because he is such a friendly, social person. The great thing about Gabe, though, is that he has figured out how to turn his love for people into an insanely valuable business skill. I had the pleasure of working with him on the marketing team at InsideSales.com, where he started to perfect his social selling playbook that has since made him famous. People love to work with him because he knows how to have fun while getting things done. I'm delighted to give Gabe my highest recommendation.

summary: Success involves doing things most people wouldn't do. What I'm good at:- B2B Social Selling Training and Coaching- Strategic Webinars, Massive Online/Virtual Events- Social Media Demand and Lead Generation (Organic and Paid)- Online Content Strategy, Creation and Distribution- Personal Branding Training & Coaching- Employment Branding- Social Media SEO- Social Selling & Social Media SpeakerGabe Villamizar is the Head of B2B Marketing at Lucid Software (Lucidchart + Lucidpress), a SaaS company with 10+ million users worldwide. He is recognized as a leading social selling and social media practitioner by LinkedIn, Forbes, Huffington Post, and Salesforce. Gabe's online courses were recently published on Lynda.com and LinkedIn Learning, and have already been watched over 30,000 times. His passion for SaaS has led him to become an advisor at xvoyant and Nova.ai, two up-and-coming tech startups. Whenever Gabe isn't tweeting (@gabevillamizar), he's most likely grilling some bomb carne asada tacos in his Traeger Grill.Specialties: B2B/B2C Social Media, Content Creation Strategy, ABM, Social SEO, Social Selling, Marketing Automation, Business Development, Social Consulting, Social Audience Development.
